data.title: homeopathy
data.meta_description: HOMEOPATHY meaning: 1. a system of treating diseases in which sick people are given very small amounts of natural…. Learn more.

Examples of homeopathy

homeopathy

It was only decades later that scientists discovered why fractionating doses definitely improves radiation therapy outcomes, and homeopathy had nothing to do with it.

Homeopathy is also incredibly effective for supporting patients in the early stages of recovery.

That's what's behind homeopathy and a lot of other alternative medicines.

After an average treatment time of 3.5 months, 75 percent of the children responded favorably to homeopathy, attaining an improvement rating of 73 percent.

Our treatments with patients might include dietary changes, supplementary nutrients, exercise, herbal medicine, pharmaceuticals or homeopathy.

Likewise, when a study shows no obvious benefits from one strategy to using these medicines, this does not necessarily disprove the entire system of homeopathy.

The conclusions on the effectiveness of homeopathy highly depend on the set of analyzed trials.

There have not, to the best of my knowledge, been any refutations of homeopathy that remain valid after this particular point is taken into account.

By its nature non-toxic, homeopathy stimulates a person's bodily systems to deal with stress and illness more efficiently.

I'm a big believer in integrative medicine and the health benefits of things like acupuncture, homeopathy, herbs, meditation and yoga.

Therapies such as acupuncture and homeopathy may help.

His plans to subject therapies such as acupuncture, homeopathy, and reflexology to rigorous scientific scrutiny quickly faced resistance.

And promote "integrated health" it did, including homeopathy.

No honest man faced with the facts of homeopathy can refuse to accept it.

There are an infinite number of flavors of this sort of nonsense, from astrology to homeopathy, from the antivaccination movement to global warming denial.

These examples are from corpora and from sources on the web. Any opinions in the examples do not represent the opinion of the Cambridge Dictionary editors or of Cambridge University Press or its licensors.
